newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Jakarta shares close higher, Sampoerna rises.
newsitem.headline: Jakarta shares close higher, Sampoerna rises.

text.p: Jakarta share prices closed higher in active trading on Monday, brokers said.
They said rises in cigarette, consumer and property shares seemed to have injected some fresh impetus to the market.
The composite index ended up 0.64 percent, or 3.97 points, at 620.86 points, hovering firmly above the psychological 600-point level on offshore support.
Gainers beat losers by 64 to 43, with 63 issues unchanged.
"It's a good day. We see some fresh funds coming in from offshore, even into the property sector," one broker said.

He attributed the fresh inflows into this long depressed sector to the fact that it was undervalued and some analysts seemed to have made some revaluations in the wake of a possible interest rate reduction next year.
The gainers in the property sector included Ciputra Development, Lippo Land and Dharmala Intiland. However, the property index eased 0.52 percent on declines in Jababeka.
Brokers said strong rises in the consumer sector, soaring 4.34 percent, seemed to have helped keep the index firming above the critical support level of 600-points.
They said the strong rise in the consumer sector was led by cigarette shares after Standard & Poors affirmed its BBB-plus local currency corporate credit rating on Sampoerna.
It also affirmed its BBB foreign currency rating on the US$200 million note issue of Sampoerna's wholly-owned subsidiary Sampoerna International Finance BV.
It said the rating outlook is stable. Sampoerna rose almost eight percent to 13,200 rupiah, which also drove Gudang Garam up 5.38 percent to 10,275 rupiah, brokers said.
One broker said profit-taking in index-heavyweight Telkom and Bank Internasional Indonesia failed to kill the momentum.
Other losers included Indah Kiat and Tjiwi Kimia.
"Overall sentiment remained firm at the close. I think the uptrend could be sustained on Tuesday," one broker said.
Telkom shed 125 rupiah, 2.94 percent, to 4,125 rupiah after the lock-up period of the shares held by its employees passed.
Brokers said anticipation of a new tariff schedule next year, pending government approval, failed to excite investors.
One local broker said investors might want to buy now ahead of the listing of Bank Negara Indonesia (BNI) shares next week.
"Overall market sentiment appears to be upbeat after the overwhelming response to BNI's share offering," he said.
He said people wanted to move in now because they hoped the listing on Monday would give another boost to the market.
Danareksa Sekuritas, lead underwriter of BNI share offering, said the issue was oversubscribed 4.46 times.
Banking shares which had risen during the BNI share offer declined on profit-taking. The finance index fell 0.89 percent on sharp fall of Bank Internasional Indonesia.
It fell 200 rupiah to 2,400 rupiah.
But brokers said overall sentiment on banking stocks remained positive despite increased profit-taking on Monday.
-- Jakarta newsroom +6221 384-6364
